XML_TEMPLATES.template:
<BlockLayout
	id=""
	models=""
	bindingContexts=""
	objectBindings=""
	Type=""
	busy="false"
	busyIndicatorDelay="1000"
	visible="true"
	fieldGroupIds="[]"
	background="Default"
	validationSuccess=""
	validationError=""
	parseError=""
	formatError=""
	modelContextChange=""
	validateFieldGroup="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
	<content></content><!-- sap.ui.layout.BlockLayoutRow -->
</BlockLayout>
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ui.layout.BlockLayout
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new BlockLayout. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.ui.layout.BlockBackgroundType (default: Default)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.layout.BlockLayoutRow[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription:
The BlockLayout is used to display several objects in a section-based manner. It features horizontal and vertical subdivisions, and full-width banners seen frequently in contemporary web design. Background colors are attached directly to these “blocks” of the layout. Special full-width sections of the BlockLayout allow horizontal scrolling through a set of blocks.
Example use cases are SAP HANA Cloud Integration and the SAPUI5 Demo Kit. In SAP HANA Cloud Integration the BlockLayout serves as a banner-like presentation of illustrative icons with associated text. By placing pictorial and textual elements side by side in different blocks, a relation of content is established. In the SAPUI5 Demo Kit the BlockLayout serves as a flexible container for diverging content, such as headings, explanatory texts, code snippets, remarks, and examples.
The BlockLayout comes in three types: Layout only (default), Bright, and Mixed background colors.

XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription:
The BlockLayoutCell is used as an aggregation of the BlockLayoutRow. It contains Controls.
The BlockLayoutCell should be used only as aggregation of the BlockLayoutRow.

XML_TEMPLATES.template:
<DynamicSideContent
	id=""
	models=""
	bindingContexts=""
	objectBindings=""
	Type=""
	busy="false"
	busyIndicatorDelay="1000"
	visible="true"
	fieldGroupIds="[]"
	showSideContent="true"
	showMainContent="true"
	sideContentVisibility="ShowAboveS"
	sideContentFallDown="OnMinimumWidth"
	equalSplit="false"
	containerQuery="false"
	sideContentPosition="End"
	validationSuccess=""
	validationError=""
	parseError=""
	formatError=""
	modelContextChange=""
	validateFieldGroup=""
	breakpointChanged="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
	<mainContent></mainContent><!-- sap.ui.core.Control -->
	<sideContent></sideContent><!-- sap.ui.core.Control -->
</DynamicSideContent>
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ui.layout.DynamicSideContent
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new DynamicSideContent. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowSideContent showSideContent} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowMainContent showMainContent} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSideContentVisibility sideContentVisibility} : sap.ui.layout.SideContentVisibility (default: ShowAboveS)
    • {@link #getSideContentFallDown sideContentFallDown} : sap.ui.layout.SideContentFallDown (default: OnMinimumWidth)
    • {@link #getEqualSplit equalSplit} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getContainerQuery containerQuery} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSideContentPosition sideContentPosition} : sap.ui.layout.SideContentPosition (default: End)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getMainContent mainContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
    • {@link #getSideContent sideContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:breakpointChanged breakpointChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription:
The DynamicSideContent control allows additional (side) content to be displayed alongside or below the main
content, within the container the control is used in. There are different size ratios between the main and
the side content for the different breakpoints. The side content position (alongside/below the main content)
and visibility (visible/hidden) can be configured per breakpoint. There are 4 predefined breakpoints:
- Screen width > 1440 px (XL breakpoint)
- Screen width <= 1440 px (L breakpoint)
- Main content width <= 600 px (M breakpoint)
- Screen width <= 720 px (S breakpoint)

<FixFlex
	id=""
	models=""
	bindingContexts=""
	objectBindings=""
	Type=""
	busy="false"
	busyIndicatorDelay="1000"
	visible="true"
	fieldGroupIds="[]"
	vertical="true"
	fixFirst="true"
	fixContentSize="auto"
	minFlexSize="0"
	validationSuccess=""
	validationError=""
	parseError=""
	formatError=""
	modelContextChange=""
	validateFieldGroup="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
	<fixContent></fixContent><!-- sap.ui.core.Control -->
	<flexContent></flexContent><!-- sap.ui.core.Control -->
</FixFlex>
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ui.layout.FixFlex
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FixFlex. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getVertical vertical} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFixFirst fixFirst} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFixContentSize fixContentSize} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: auto)
    • {@link #getMinFlexSize minFlexSize} : int (default: 0)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getFixContent fixContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getFlexContent flexContent} : sap.ui.core.Control
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription:
The FixFlex control builds the container for a layout with a fixed and a flexible part. The flexible container adapts its size to the fix container. The fix container can hold any number of controls, while the flexible container can hold only one.

In order for the FixFlex to stretch properly, the parent element, in which the control is placed, needs to have a specified height or needs to have an absolute position.

Warning: Avoid nesting FixFlex in other flexbox based layout controls (FixFlex, FlexBox, Hbox, Vbox). Otherwise contents may be not accessible or multiple scrollbars can appear.

Note: If the child control of the flex or the fix container has width/height bigger than the container itself, the child control will be cropped in the view. If minFlexSize is set, then a scrollbar is shown in the flexible part, depending on the vertical property.

	id=""

	bindingContexts=""

	Type=""
	busy="false"

	visible="true"
	fieldGroupIds="[]"
	width="100%"
	vSpacing="1"
	hSpacing="1"
	position="Left"
	defaultSpan="XL3 L3 M6 S12"
	defaultIndent="XL0 L0 M0 S0"
	containerQuery="false"
	ariaLabelledBy=""
	validationSuccess=""
	validationError=""
	parseError=""
	formatError=""
	modelContextChange=""
	validateFieldGroup="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
	<content></content><!-- sap.ui.core.Control -->
</Grid>
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ui.layout.Grid
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Grid. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getVSpacing vSpacing} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getHSpacing hSpacing} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getPosition position} : sap.ui.layout.GridPosition (default: Left)
    • {@link #getDefaultSpan defaultSpan} : sap.ui.layout.GridSpan (default: XL3 L3 M6 S12)
    • {@link #getDefaultIndent defaultIndent} : sap.ui.layout.GridIndent (default: XL0 L0 M0 S0)
    • {@link #getContainerQuery containerQuery} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription: The Grid control is a layout which positions its child controls in a 12 column flow layout. Its children can be specified to take on a variable amount of columns depending on available screen size. With this control it is possible to achieve flexible layouts and line-breaks for extra large-, large-, medium- and small-sized screens, such as large desktop, desktop, tablet, and mobile. The Grid control's width can be percentage- or pixel-based and the spacing between its columns can be set to various pre-defined values.

XML_TEMPLATES.template:
<Splitter
	id=""
	models=""
	bindingContexts=""
	objectBindings=""
	Type=""

	visible="true"
	fieldGroupIds="[]"
	orientation="Horizontal"
	width="100%"
	height="100%"
	validationSuccess=""

	formatError=""

	resize="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
	<contentAreas></contentAreas><!-- sap.ui.core.Control -->
</Splitter>
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ui.layout.Splitter
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Splitter. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getOrientation orientation} : sap.ui.core.Orientation (default: Horizontal)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContentAreas contentAreas} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:resize resize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription:
A layout that contains several content areas. The content that is added to the splitter should contain LayoutData of the type SplitterLayoutData that defines its size and size contraints.

By adding or changing SplitterLayoutData to the controls that make up the content areas, the size can be changed programatically. Additionally the contents can be made non-resizable individually and a minimal size (in px) can be set.

The orientation of the splitter can be set to horizontal (default) or vertical. All content areas of the splitter will be arranged in that way. In order to split vertically and horizontally at the same time, Splitters need to be nested.

The splitter bars can be focused to enable resizing of the content areas via keyboard. The contents size can be manipulated when the splitter bar is focused and Shift-Left/Down/Right/Up are pressed. When Shift-Home/End are pressed, the contents are set their minimum or maximum size (keep in mind though, that resizing an auto-size content-area next to another auto-size one might lead to the effect that the former does not take its maximum size but only the maximum size before recalculating auto sizes).

The splitter bars used for resizing the contents by the user can be set to different widths (or heights in vertical mode) and the splitter will automatically resize the other contents accordingly. In case the splitter bar is resized after the splitter has rendered, a manual resize has to be triggered by invoking triggerResize() on the Splitter.

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getFormContainers formContainers} : sap.ui.layout.form.FormContainer[] (default)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.ui.core.Title|string
    • {@link #getToolbar toolbar} : sap.ui.core.Toolbar
    • {@link #getLayout layout} : sap.ui.layout.form.FormLayout
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription: Form control. A Form is structured into FormContainers. Each FormContainer consists of FormElements. The FormElements consists of a label and the form fields. A Form doesn't render its content by itself. The rendering is done by the assigned FormLayout. This is so that the rendering can be adopted to new UI requirements without changing the Form itself. For the content of a Form, VariantLayoutData are supported to allow simple switching of the FormLayout. LayoutData on the content can be used to overwrite the default layout of the code>Form. Note: Do not put any layout controls into the FormElements. This could destroy the visual layout, keyboard support and screen-reader support.

XML_TEMPLATES.template:
<FormContainer
	id=""
	models=""
	bindingContexts=""
	objectBindings=""
	Type=""
	expanded="true"
	expandable="false"
	visible="true"
	ariaLabelledBy=""
	validationSuccess=""
	validationError=""
	parseError=""
	formatError=""
	modelContextChange="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
	<formElements></formElements><!-- sap.ui.layout.form.FormElement -->
	<title></title><!-- sap.ui.core.Title -->
	<toolbar></toolbar><!-- sap.ui.core.Toolbar -->
</FormContainer>
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ui.layout.form.FormContainer
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.layout.form.FormContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getExpanded expanded} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getExpandable expandable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getFormElements formElements} : sap.ui.layout.form.FormElement[] (default)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.ui.core.Title|string
    • {@link #getToolbar toolbar} : sap.ui.core.Toolbar
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription: A FormContainer represents a group inside a Form. It consists of FormElements. The rendering of the FormContainer is done by the FormLayout assigned to the Form.

XML_TEMPLATES.template:
<FormElement
	id=""
	models=""
	bindingContexts=""
	objectBindings=""
	Type=""
	visible="true"
	validationSuccess=""
	validationError=""
	parseError=""
	formatError=""
	modelContextChange="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
	<label></label><!-- sap.ui.core.Label -->
	<fields></fields><!-- sap.ui.core.Control -->
</FormElement>
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ui.layout.form.FormElement
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.layout.form.FormElement. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getLabel label} : sap.ui.core.Label|string
    • {@link #getFields fields} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription: A FormElement represents a row in a FormContainer. A FormElement is a combination of one label and different controls associated to this label.

XML_TEMPLATES.template:
<FormLayout
	id=""
	models=""
	bindingContexts=""
	objectBindings=""
	Type=""
	busy="false"
	busyIndicatorDelay="1000"
	visible="true"
	fieldGroupIds="[]"
	backgroundDesign="Translucent"
	validationSuccess=""
	validationError=""
	parseError=""
	formatError=""
	modelContextChange=""
	validateFieldGroup="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
</FormLayout>
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ui.layout.form.FormLayout
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.layout.form.FormLayout. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getBackgroundDesign backgroundDesign} : sap.ui.layout.BackgroundDesign (default: Translucent)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription: Base layout to render a Form. Other layouts to render a Form must inherit from this one. Note: This control must not be used to render a Form in productive applications as it does not fulfill any design guidelines and usability standards.

XML_TEMPLATES.template:
<GridLayout
	id=""
	models=""
	bindingContexts=""
	objectBindings=""
	Type=""
	busy="false"
	busyIndicatorDelay="1000"
	visible="true"
	fieldGroupIds="[]"
	backgroundDesign="Translucent"
	singleColumn="false"
	validationSuccess=""
	validationError=""
	parseError=""
	formatError=""
	modelContextChange=""
	validateFieldGroup="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
</GridLayout>
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ui.layout.form.GridLayout
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.layout.form.GridLayout. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getSingleColumn singleColumn} : boolean (default: false)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.layout.form.FormLayout#constructor sap.ui.layout.form.FormLayout} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription: This FormLayout renders a Form using a HTML-table based grid. This can be a 16 column grid or an 8 column grid. The grid is stable, so the alignment of the fields is the same for all screen sizes or widths of the Form. Only the width of the single grid columns depends on the available width. To adjust the appearance inside the GridLayout, you can use GridContainerData for FormContainers and GridElementData for content fields. Note: If content fields have a width property this will be ignored, as the width of the controls is set by the grid cells. This control cannot be used stand alone, it only renders a Form, so it must be assigned to a Form.

XML_TEMPLATES.template:
<ResponsiveGridLayout
	id=""
	models=""
	bindingContexts=""
	objectBindings=""
	Type=""
	busy="false"
	busyIndicatorDelay="1000"
	visible="true"
	fieldGroupIds="[]"
	backgroundDesign="Translucent"
	labelSpanXL="-1"
	labelSpanL="4"
	labelSpanM="2"
	labelSpanS="12"
	adjustLabelSpan="true"
	emptySpanXL="-1"
	emptySpanL="0"
	emptySpanM="0"
	emptySpanS="0"
	columnsXL="-1"
	columnsL="2"
	columnsM="1"
	singleContainerFullSize="true"
	breakpointXL="1440"
	breakpointL="1024"
	breakpointM="600"
	validationSuccess=""
	validationError=""
	parseError=""
	formatError=""
	modelContextChange=""
	validateFieldGroup="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
</ResponsiveGridLayout>
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ui.layout.form.ResponsiveGridLayout
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.layout.form.ResponsiveGridLayout. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getLabelSpanXL labelSpanXL} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getLabelSpanL labelSpanL} : int (default: 4)
    • {@link #getLabelSpanM labelSpanM} : int (default: 2)
    • {@link #getLabelSpanS labelSpanS} : int (default: 12)
    • {@link #getAdjustLabelSpan adjustLabelSpan} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEmptySpanXL emptySpanXL} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getEmptySpanL emptySpanL} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getEmptySpanM emptySpanM} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getEmptySpanS emptySpanS} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getColumnsXL columnsXL} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getColumnsL columnsL} : int (default: 2)
    • {@link #getColumnsM columnsM} : int (default: 1)
    • {@link #getSingleContainerFullSize singleContainerFullSize} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getBreakpointXL breakpointXL} : int (default: 1440)
    • {@link #getBreakpointL breakpointL} : int (default: 1024)
    • {@link #getBreakpointM breakpointM} : int (default: 600)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.layout.form.FormLayout#constructor sap.ui.layout.form.FormLayout} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription: Renders a Form using a responsive grid. Internally the Grid control is used for rendering. Using this layout, the Form is rendered in a responsive way. Depending on the available space, the FormContainers are rendered in one or different columns and the labels are rendered in the same row as the fields or above the fields. This behavior can be influenced by the properties of this layout control. On the FormContainers, labels and content fields, GridData can be used to change the default rendering. GridData is not supported for FormElements. Note: If GridData is used, this may result in a much more complex layout than the default one. This means that in some cases, the calculation for the other content may not bring the expected result. In such cases, GridData should be used for all content controls to disable the default behavior. This control cannot be used standalone, it only renders a Form, so it must be assigned to a Form.

XML_TEMPLATES.template:
<ResponsiveLayout
	id=""
	models=""
	bindingContexts=""
	objectBindings=""
	Type=""
	busy="false"
	busyIndicatorDelay="1000"
	visible="true"
	fieldGroupIds="[]"
	backgroundDesign="Translucent"
	validationSuccess=""
	validationError=""
	parseError=""
	formatError=""
	modelContextChange=""
	validateFieldGroup="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
</ResponsiveLayout>
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ui.layout.form.ResponsiveLayout
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription: Constructor for a new sap.ui.layout.form.ResponsiveLayout.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription: Renders a Form with a responsive layout. Internally the ResponsiveFlowLayout is used. The responsiveness of this layout tries to best use the available space. This means that the order of the FormContainers, labels and fields depends on the available space. On the FormContainers, FormElements, labels and content fields, ResponsiveFlowLayoutData can be used to change the default rendering. We suggest using the ResponsiveGridLayout instead of this layout because this is easier to consume and brings more stable responsive output. Note: If ResponsiveFlowLayoutData are used this may result in a much more complex layout than the default one. This means that in some cases, the calculation for the other content may not bring the expected result. In such cases, ResponsiveFlowLayoutData should be used for all content controls to disable the default behavior. This control cannot be used stand alone, it only renders a Form, so it must be assigned to a Form.

XML_TEMPLATES.template:
<SimpleForm
	id=""
	models=""
	bindingContexts=""
	objectBindings=""
	Type=""
	busy="false"
	busyIndicatorDelay="1000"
	visible="true"
	fieldGroupIds="[]"
	maxContainerCols="2"
	minWidth="-1"
	width=""
	editable=""
	labelMinWidth="192"
	layout="ResponsiveLayout"
	labelSpanXL="-1"
	labelSpanL="4"
	labelSpanM="2"
	labelSpanS="12"
	adjustLabelSpan="true"
	emptySpanXL="-1"
	emptySpanL="0"
	emptySpanM="0"
	emptySpanS="0"
	columnsXL="-1"
	columnsL="2"
	columnsM="1"
	singleContainerFullSize="true"
	breakpointXL="1440"
	breakpointL="1024"
	breakpointM="600"
	backgroundDesign="Translucent"
	ariaLabelledBy=""
	validationSuccess=""
	validationError=""
	parseError=""
	formatError=""
	modelContextChange=""
	validateFieldGroup="">
	<tooltip></tooltip><!-- sap.ui.core.TooltipBase -->
	<customData></customData><!-- sap.ui.core.CustomData -->
	<layoutData></layoutData><!-- sap.ui.core.LayoutData -->
	<dependents></dependents><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
	<content></content><!-- sap.ui.core.Element -->
	<form></form><!-- sap.ui.layout.form.Form -->
	<title></title><!-- sap.ui.core.Title -->
	<toolbar></toolbar><!-- sap.ui.core.Toolbar -->
</SimpleForm>
XML_TEMPLATES.name: sap.ui.layout.form.SimpleForm
XML_TEMPLATES.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.layout.form.SimpleForm. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getMaxContainerCols maxContainerCols} : int (default: 2)
    • {@link #getMinWidth minWidth} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean
    • {@link #getLabelMinWidth labelMinWidth} : int (default: 192)
    • {@link #getLayout layout} : sap.ui.layout.form.SimpleFormLayout (default: ResponsiveLayout)
    • {@link #getLabelSpanXL labelSpanXL} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getLabelSpanL labelSpanL} : int (default: 4)
    • {@link #getLabelSpanM labelSpanM} : int (default: 2)
    • {@link #getLabelSpanS labelSpanS} : int (default: 12)
    • {@link #getAdjustLabelSpan adjustLabelSpan} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEmptySpanXL emptySpanXL} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getEmptySpanL emptySpanL} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getEmptySpanM emptySpanM} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getEmptySpanS emptySpanS} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getColumnsXL columnsXL} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getColumnsL columnsL} : int (default: 2)
    • {@link #getColumnsM columnsM} : int (default: 1)
    • {@link #getSingleContainerFullSize singleContainerFullSize} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getBreakpointXL breakpointXL} : int (default: 1440)
    • {@link #getBreakpointL breakpointL} : int (default: 1024)
    • {@link #getBreakpointM breakpointM} : int (default: 600)
    • {@link #getBackgroundDesign backgroundDesign} : sap.ui.layout.BackgroundDesign (default: Translucent)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Element[] (default)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.ui.core.Title|string
    • {@link #getToolbar toolbar} : sap.ui.core.Toolbar
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
XML_TEMPLATES.helpDescription:
The SimpleForm provides an easy-to-use API to create simple forms. Inside a SimpleForm, a Form control is created along with its FormContainers and FormElements, but the complexity in the API is removed.
  • A new title starts a new group (FormContainer) in the form.
  • A new label starts a new row (FormElement) in the form.
  • All other controls will be assigned to the row (FormElement) started with the last label.
Use LayoutData to influence the layout for special cases in the Input/Display controls. Note: If a more complex form is needed, use Form instead.
